intro: Silene pteropleura, commonly known as the winged catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. Silene pteropleura is known for its short blooming period, usually in late summer, and is often found in moist or slightly shaded habitats.
